intro: Oerstedella adolphii, commonly known as the Adolph's sunflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, typical of the family. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
